oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tanya Tucker Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview with Tanya Tucker (performer) conducted by Biff Collie. Segment features commentary from La Costa Tucker (performer). Segment is recorded on May 22, 1989.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tanya Tucker; Biff Collie; La Costa Tucker
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tanya Tucker and Biff Collie discuss Tucker's family dynamic and her father's work -- (02:10) Tucker reflects on her family's artistic talent and her inclination to country music -- (03:48) Tucker discusses the difficulties associated to moving to Nashville; additionally, Tucker recalls meeting Hank Williams and others while recording -- (05:28) Tucker recalls the time she went Mary Davis' home -- (06:58) Tucker describes the moves her father made to foster Tucker's musical career -- (09:02) Tucker discusses the improvisational style her family lived by -- (10:37) Collie and Tucker discuss Tucker's childhood performances, and Tucker discusses how she sent out a number of demo tapes -- (12:24) Tucker recalls how she was punished by a teacher for something her mother did -- (15:21) Tucker praises her middle school teachers -- (16:09) Tucker and La Costa discuss the time Tucker lost a talent show to La Costa -- (18:07) La Costa Tucker and Tanya joke about their sibling rivalry -- (19:33) Tanya discusses how she had to sing in order to get approval to rent a home -- (20:27) Tanya reflects on how she met Billy Sherrill -- (22:48) Tanya reveals she was twelve the first time she recorded a record -- (23:30) Collie brings back up the story of how Tanya had to sing in order to get approval to rent a home -- (25:30) Tanya discuses how Sherrill gave Tucker access to a number of great songs -- (28:24) Collie and Tanya discuss the first session Tanya had done with Sherrill -- (31:04) Tanya reflects on the interesting people in her life that influenced her -- (32:32) Tanya and Collie discusses Tanya's successful albums, and Tanya continuing to work with Sherrill -- (33:53) Tanya discusses continuing her education while being a successful artist -- (35:37) Tanya recalls moving to Nashville in 1977 -- (35:50) Tanya recalls her favorite part of moving away from Arizona, and Collie and Tanya discuss the rough parts of music -- (37:02) Tanya reflects on how she signed with MCA Records when she was sixteen -- (38:34) Tanya continues to discuss the difficulty in leaving Sherrill -- (39:23) Tanya reflects on the difficulty with her coming to terms with her new MCA producer -- (42:34) Tanya reveals her desire for a relationship, and Tanya and Collie discuss Tanya's love interests [recording skips] -- (44:17) Collie and Tanya discuss the difference of living in Hollywood and Nashville -- (46:09) Tanya and Collie discuss Tanya's past drug problems -- (51:09) Collie and Tanya discuss how Tanya almost owned a boutique -- (51:45) Tanya and Collie discuss Tanya's relationship with Glen Campbell -- (52:56) Tanya reflects on what she would be doing if she was not an artist -- (55:58) Collie inquires about Tanya's horse collection, and Tanya reveals she sold them to Loretta Lynn -- (57:00) Tanya describes how Jimmy Rogers inspires her, and Tanya reveals her part of the Superstar Salute to Jimmy Rogers -- (1:00:00) Tanya discusses how she created the video for "Daddy and Home" -- (1:02:40) Tanya recalls meeting Elvis Presley, and Tanya discusses Ernest Tubb -- (1:04:36) Tanya and La Costa joke about La Costa taking dates from Tanya, and both discuss Tanya's children -- (1:06:26) Collie and the Tuckers praise each other and say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tucker, Tanya; Collie, Biff;
